name.namePart: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY BLUE CAMPAIGN AUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 209

congVote.result: So the motion to concur was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Department of Homeland Security Blue Campaign Authorization Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. 1370, to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to issue Department of Homeland Security-wide guidance and develop training programs as part of the Department of Homeland Security Blue Campaign, with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-52, by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 708.

congCommittee.name: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

titleInfo.title: United States House Concurrent Resolution 71 (115th Congress)

extension.searchTitle: FURTHER SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2018; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 209

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Further Additional Supplemental Appropriations for Disaster Relief Requirements, 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4667, making further supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2018, for disaster assistance for Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria, and calendar year 2017 wildfires, by a yea-and-nay vote of 251 yeas to 169 nays, Roll No. 709.

titleInfo.title: NO HUMAN TRAFFICKING ON OUR ROADS ACT

extension.searchTitle: NO HUMAN TRAFFICKING ON OUR ROADS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 209

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: No Human Trafficking on Our Roads Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Tuesday, December 19th.<P/>S. 1532, to disqualify from operating a commercial motor vehicle for life an individual who uses a commercial motor vehicle in committing a felony involving human trafficking, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 393 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 710.

titleInfo.title: DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY BLUE CAMPAIGN AUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY BLUE CAMPAIGN AUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 209

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn having voted in the affirmative, the motion is agreed to and the point of order falls.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 66 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 325), Senate agreed to the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to H.R. 1370, to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to issue Department of Homeland Security-wide guidance and develop training programs as part of the Department of Homeland Security Blue Campaign. (A unanimous-consent agreement was reached providing that the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to the bill, having achieved 60 affirmatives votes, be agreed to.)<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 91 yeas to 8 nays (Vote No. 324), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to waive all applicable sections of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 and applicable budget resolution for the purpose of the House message to accompany the bill. Subsequently, the point of order that the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to the bill was in violation of section 306 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 was not sustained, and the point of order fails.

<P/>By 66 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 325), Senate agreed to the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to H.R. 1370, to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to issue Department of Homeland Security-wide guidance and develop training programs as part of the Department of Homeland Security Blue Campaign. (A unanimous-consent agreement was reached providing that the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to the bill, having achieved 60 affirmatives votes, be agreed to.)

<P/>By 66 yeas to 32 nays (Vote No. 325), Senate agreed to the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to H.R. 1370, to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to issue Department of Homeland Security-wide guidance and develop training programs as part of the Department of Homeland Security Blue Campaign. (A unanimous-consent agreement was reached providing that the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to the bill, having achieved 60 affirmatives votes, be agreed to.)<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 91 yeas to 8 nays (Vote No. 324), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to waive all applicable sections of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 and applicable budget resolution for the purpose of the House message to accompany the bill. Subsequently, the point of order that the motion to concur in the amendment of the House to the amendment of the Senate to the bill was in violation of section 306 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 was not sustained, and the point of order fails.
